Message.MsgText: INF_CH_CHFE=CWWSB0004I: A CompensationHandlerFailedException was caught from the compensation handler, {0}.
Message.Explanation: The compensation handler threw a CompensationHanderFailedException and will not be retried.
Message.UserResponse: No action required. This message is for informational purposes only.

Message.MsgText: ERR_CH_MISSING=CWWSB0002E: The user defined compensation hander class could not be found, {0}. Exception details follow: {1}
Message.Explanation: An error occurred trying to locate and create the user-defined compensation handler class. This class must exist and be available to the application.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure that the specified class name is the fully qualified class name of the compensation hander and that the class name is on the application class path.

Message.MsgText: ERR_CH_INTERFACE=CWWSB0003E: The user defined compensation handler, {0}, does not implement the {1} interface.
Message.Explanation: The user-defined compensation handler class must implement the appropriate CompensationHandler interface for it to be added to the Business Activity.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the user-defined compensation handler class implements the appropriate CompensationHandler interface and that the corresponding UserBusinessActivity method is used to set the compensation data.

Message.MsgText: ERR_CH_NULL=CWWSB0005E: The compensation handler class name has not been specified on the application component.
Message.Explanation: If an application component does not specify a compensation handler class name, it is not permitted to call the setCompensationDataImmediate() or setCompensationDataAtCommit() methods.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the compensation handler class name is specified on your application component.

Message.MsgText: ERR_WSBA_DISABLED=CWWSB0001E: WS-BA has not been enabled.
Message.Explanation: When the WS-BA function is disabled the application cannot make WS-BA API calls.
Message.UserResponse: Ensure the WS-BA functionality has been enabled on the application component.
